Issues.Body:

by merging a specified PR.  Often the question is brought up of how
many PRs require a rebase as a result of a change.  This script allows
to determine this impact.

Issues.Title: HashLocationStrategy does not change hash when redirecting in canActivate Guard
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No, at least I can confirm that this issue was also present in version 8 of Angular ### Description Please have a look at the reproduction example at Stackblitz. The issue can be reproduced as follows: 1. Open the application 1. Change the URL in the URL Bar to `.../#/bar` and hit Enter OR change the location by entering `location.href = '#/bar` in the console. 1. The state of the application does not change (this is expected as we are on `/start`) 1. The URL still displays `.../#/bar` even though we have been redirected to `/start`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-bejfwf](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-bejfwf) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.3.24
Node: 12.16.1
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.14
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.803.24
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.803.24
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.803.24
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.803.24
@angular-devkit/core               7.3.9
@angular-devkit/schematics         8.3.24
@angular/cdk                       8.2.3
@angular/cli                       8.3.24
@angular/flex-layout               8.0.0-beta.27
@angular/material                  8.2.3
@angular/material-moment-adapter   8.2.3
@ngtools/webpack                   8.3.24
@schematics/angular                8.3.24
@schematics/update                 0.803.24
rxjs                               6.5.4
typescript                         3.5.3
webpack                            4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** I tried to find the issue within the router code and it seems that `this.browserUrlTree` still points to `/start` on this lines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/acf6075ca9aa92121bb0166b2b7560aeb2c167ff/packages/router/src/router.ts#L474..L475 Therefore the angular router detects that the state of the application does not need to change (which is correct) but we still would need to change the URL to the one we redirected to.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HashLocationStrategy does not change hash when redirecting in canActivate Guard" (#37048)

Issues.Title: Issue after migrating to ANgular 9 - error NG6001: Cannot declare 'Button' in an NgModule as it's not a part of the current compilation.
Issues.Body:
Hi, I am facing an issue after migrating to Angular 9 - error NG6001: Cannot declare 'Button' in an NgModule as it's not a part of the current compilation. ### Is this a regression? Yes, with Angular 8 we were able to load Angular library and import only components which are needed, not the entire module. ### Description I have an Angular 9 application (Ivy Compiled) which uses Angular 9 Library (View Engine/ Non Ivy compiled). When importing the module I am able to use the components and directives inside the library. But when I tried to import the component or directive directly then I am getting an error. error NG6001: Cannot declare 'Button' in an NgModule as it's not a part of the current compilation. Before migrating to Angular 9 I was able to import individual components and controls from Angular Library(v8). **Why we need to import individual components?** We would like to reduce the types imported to support tree shaking. Assumption is the library consumers will get the package size according to the number of components used from the Angular Library. What we observed is when we import module we will end up adding the contents of the entire module. ## üî• Exception or Error 

Warning: Entry point '@ourlibrary/angular' contains deep imports into 'D:/ourlibrary/temp10/node_modules/@ourlibrary/core/button'. This is probably not a problem, but may cause the compilation of entry points to be out of order.

ERROR in src/app/app.module.ts:10:5 - error NG6001: Cannot declare 'Button' in an NgModule as it's not a part of the current compilation.

10     Button
       ~~~~~~

  node_modules/@ourlibrary/angular/lib/button.component.d.ts:5:22
    5 export declare class Button {
                           ~~~~~~
    'Button' is declared here.
src/app/app.component.html:1:1 - error NG8001: 'our-button' is not a known element:
1. If 'our-button' is an Angular component, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'our-button' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.

1 
  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.

** Angular Live Development Server is listening on localhost:4200, open
your browser on http://localhost:4200/ **
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.4
Node: 12.13.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Access data of route by URL before navigation
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for @angular/router


### Description
My goal is to automatically display in my menu (and other pages) only links that a user can access.
All the info required for this is usually stored within the module routes:
- the `path` field contains the string that allows to map a "url" into a component 
- The `data` field may contain the authorities for the user that can access the component

It would be great if I could retrieve the routes before loading the whole module for lazy loading purposes. Also exposing the recognize fonction of the router would allow to convert any "url" to the route and retrieve it's `data` and no whether or nor to display the link.


### Describe the solution you'd like
have the ability to bundle the routes within the main components:
globaly:
```
RouterModule.forRoot(routes, {eagerRouteData: true})
```
or Per Route
```
{
    path: 'customer',
    loadChildren: () => import('./customer/customer.module').then(m => m.CustomerModule),
    eagerRouteData: true
},
```
We should also add a fonction that would go through all the redirects if any ... and returns the route, the routeTransition, the ActivatedRouteSnapshot that would result from a navigation to that url or anything that would allow as to read the data of the destination route.

Once a spec of what needs to be coded is specified I would gladly help coding it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Access data of route by URL before navigation" (#37041)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): correctly get config for packages in nested `node_modules/`
Issues.Body:
Previously, ngcc would only be able to match an ngcc configuration to packages that were located inside the project's top-level `node_modules/`. However, if there are multiple versions of a package in a project (e.g. as a transitive dependency of other packages), multiple copies of a package (at different versions) may exist in nested `node_modules/` directories. For example, one at `<project-root>/node_modules/some-package/` and one at `<project-root>/node_modules/other-package/node_modules/some-package/`. In such cases, ngcc was only able to detect the config for the first copy but not for the second.

This commit fixes this by returning a new instance of `ProcessedNgccPackageConfig` for each different package path (even if they refer to the same package name). In these `ProcessedNgccPackageConfig`, the `entryPoints` paths have been processed to take the package path into account.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): correctly get config for packages in nested `node_modules/`" (#37040)

Issues.Title: Angular 9 Issue with MIME Types for Production Build
Issues.Body:
So I have an Angular 9 application, it has 3 main routes:
/ - Home
/dashboard
/dashboard/guilds

To get to the Dashboard, you can either click a link and have the router navigate you, or you can directly enter it in in your address bar: /dashboard

In the dashboard route, there is a button that when clicked, it will programmatically navigate with the router to /dashboard/guilds. I can then view my component just fine, however, if I refresh the page, I get this issue:

```
Failed to load module script: The server responded with a non-JavaScript MIME type of "text/html". Strict MIME type checking is enforced for module scripts per HTML spec.
06:12:19.128 polyfills-es2015.3fd94ed6a324eee92aec.js:1 Failed to load module script: The server responded with a non-JavaScript MIME type of "text/html". Strict MIME type checking is enforced for module scripts per HTML spec.
06:12:19.128 main-es2015.0b1d748ffcf78a2a0b26.js:1 Failed to load module script: The server responded with a non-JavaScript MIME type of "text/html". Strict MIME type checking is enforced for module scripts per HTML spec.
```

I don't know why, it works fine locally, so I guess it's something to do with my Production Server? I have NGINX running. If needed, I will provide the server block config.

I've tried some stuff here: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30835 but I've never had this issue with Angular 8 before. And this one seems very specific, it's not like the page doesn't load, it just throws that error if I try to manually visit that route instead of letting the Angular Router navigate for me.

index.html from build 
```
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>SomeWebsite</title>
  <base href="./">  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  <link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="favicon.ico">
  <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:300,400,500&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
  <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.8426c2fc899c530c7f78.css"></head>
<body class="mat-typography">
  <app-root></app-root>
<script src="runtime-es2015.0811dcefd377500b5b1a.js" type="module"></script><script src="runtime-es5.0811dcefd377500b5b1a.js" nomodule defer></script><script src="polyfills-es5.c219b7059a7feb126472.js" nomodule defer></script><script src="polyfills-es2015.3fd94ed6a324eee92aec.js" type="module"></script><script src="main-es2015.0b1d748ffcf78a2a0b26.js" type="module"></script><script src="main-es5.0b1d748ffcf78a2a0b26.js" nomodule defer></script></body>
</html>
``` I've tried changing type="text/javascript" but no luck, I just got some "> token error" I don't really remember.

I'm not sure what else is needed, but if anyone knows what the issue and how I could fix it, I would appreciate it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 9 Issue with MIME Types for Production Build" (#37037)

Issues.Title: Angular not installed
Issues.Body:
When I install a new Angular app with the following command, it doesn't install and it only installs packages for hours.
```
ng new my-app
```
When I forcibly stop the installation and want to do a test to run the app and hit the following command, I see that no package is installed and gives the following error.
```
cd my-app
ng serve --open
```

```
An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot find module '@angular-devkit/build-angular/package.json'
See "C:\Users\Hossien\AppData\Local\Temp\ng-sIDAvL\angular-errors.log" for further details.
```
I searched in other refrences, but the problem is not solved

--------------------------
Angular CLI: 9.1.5
Node: 10.15.1
Npm: 6.14.5
OS: windows - x64
Browser: chrome

Issues.Title: Cannot instantiate cyclic dependency! When injecting a custom service
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

I'm getting this error for a couple of days, may be after upgrading angular/core to 9.1.4:

An interesting error because when I refreshed the page, it works. Also sometimes without refreshing works but there is nothing that I did to make it work or throw.

Custom service is my LogService that injects these classes:     AngularFirestore, UserProgressService UserService,

This service is not different from other services that I use except for inceject parameters, does it be related with them?

AppModule includes this service in providers.

UserProgressService AngularFirestore, UserService
UserService injects: AngularFireAuth, Events, AngularFirestore.

Detailed error message is:

_Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot instantiate cyclic dependency! LogService
Error: Cannot instantiate cyclic dependency! LogService_

It seems not a actual cyclic dependency issue, since it may sometimes work.

Relations are here:
LogService <- UserProgressService <- UserService <- AngularFireAuth, Events, AngularFirestore
LogService <- UserProgressService <- AngularFirestore
LogService <- UserService <- AngularFireAuth, Events, AngularFirestore
LogService <- AngularFirestore
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot instantiate cyclic dependency! When injecting a custom service" (#37032)

Issues.Title: Uncompressed Index.html and Service Worker causes Hash Mismatch error when served through CDN
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x ] build ### Is this a regression? No ### Description It seems that when creating a productions build, Angular CLI compresses all files except `Index.html` and `Service Worker`. Now when we deploy the files on server where static contents are served through CDN, CDN applies different optimizations on these files (minify/compress), As a result the `Hash` value for these files also changes, and hence service worker throws `Hash Mismatch`. This issue is also reported here https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/23613 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Deploy a project on server and serve static contents using CDN for example CloudFlare. And when testing website in browser you should be able to see the error. ## üî• Exception or Error 
Hash Mismatch
## üåç Your Environment 

This applies to all versions and any browser that support Service Workers
**Anything else relevant?** In my case I was able to solve the issue as mentioned in comment https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/23613#issuecomment-626344959 It would be great if this could be fixed in Angular CLI so that we dont have to fix it manually.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Uncompressed Index.html and Service Worker causes Hash Mismatch error when served through CDN" (#17700)

Issues.Title: Adding custom CopyPlugin pattern will overwrite assets to copy defined in angular.json
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description When using the webpack CopyPlugin in custom webpack configuration for building app, it overwrite the assets defined in angular.json (/projects/production-orders-web-client/architect/build/options/assets) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a fresh app: `ng new ` 2. Add dependency for Angular 8: `npm i @angular-builders/custom-webpack@8 -D` 3. Add at the root a custom-webpack.config.js file with: ``` const path = require('path'); const CopyPlugin = require('copy-webpack-plugin'); module.exports = { plugins: [new CopyPlugin( [{ from: path.join(__dirname, 'src', 'test-0.txt'), to: 'test-0.txt' }] )] }; ``` 4. Add in angular.json, in /projects/test-copy/architect/build/options ``` "customWebpackConfig": { "path": "./custom-webpack.config.js" } ``` 5. Add test file to copy in src: `touch src/test-0.txt` 6. Add test file to copy in assets: `touch src/assets/test-1.txt` 7. Run: `ng build` Expected copied file dist: ``` - assets/test-1.txt - favicon.ico - test-0.txt ``` Actual copied file dist: ``` - assets/test-1.txt - test-0.txt ``` ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.26
Node: 12.13.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.14
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.803.26
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.803.26
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.803.26
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.803.26
@angular-devkit/core              8.3.26
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.3.26
@angular/cli                      8.3.26
@ngtools/webpack                  8.3.26
@schematics/angular               8.3.26
@schematics/update                0.803.26
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.5.3
webpack                           4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** I'm using this CopyPlugin to have more flexibility when building the app, like transforming the content of the file. I know this might not be supported at the moment, but will it be possible to **merge** with other Webpack Copy instead of overwriting ?

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): getCanonicalFileName should return FS compatible paths
Issues.Body:
Unlike TSC which has it's own mechanism the resolve and join paths in POSIX format, NGTSC heavily relies onNode.JS `fs` and `path` modules. This prevents `Path` usage because in Windows `path.resolve` will causes an absolute path to be resolved or joined incorrectly.  Example:  `/D/MyPath/MyProject` -> `D:/d/mypath/myproject`.

With this change we change the `getCanonicalFileName` method to return FS compatible paths.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): getCanonicalFileName should return FS compatible paths" (#17692)

Issues.Title: The Angular CLI requires a minimum Node.js version of either v10.13 or v12.0
Issues.Body:
I have windows 10. I updated angular-cli to the laest recommended version trough npm. When i run "ng serve" in my project I get this error: 
"Node.js version v11.13.0 detected.
The Angular CLI requires a minimum Node.js version of either v10.13 or v12.0.

Please update your Node.js version or visit https://nodejs.org/ for additional instructions."
I downloaded and installed the latest node.js version 12.6.3
When I run "node -v" I get 12.6.3 but when I run "ng serve" I still get the same error and angular clames that node.js v.11.3.0 has been detected.
There is probably something in the project that I need to change.

No, I think it has always happened, but no one noticed or tried this. ### Description Trying to localize the app, but `index.html` is not a component, so `i18n` directive doesn't work in it, trying to generate different index files for each locale works ok when built with `--configuration=es-CO` but not when using `--localize` to build all locales at once. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repro repo: https://github.com/luchillo17/angular-issue17684-repro Steps: 1. Issues.Title: The pacote dependency should be re-evaluated
Issues.Body:
I'm not sure exactly how to put it, but the `@angular/cli` and `@schematics/update` packages depend on [pacote](https://www.npmjs.com/package/pacote), a JavaScript Package Handler that has ~2M weekly downloads and only 8 peoples watching the [project on GitHub](https://github.com/npm/pacote), now there are 9.

This looks like a recipe for a left-pad scale disaster, but with big security implications. I would like to to invite some of the Angular contributors to start watching this project and maybe evaluate if it's really needed.

P.S. For comparison, the `@angular/core` package is downloaded 1.5M times a week.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The pacote dependency should be re-evaluated" (#17677)

Issues.Title: bug([mat-table]): [Nested ng-container inside mat-table stopped working]
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

When updating @ angular / material to version 9, the template with the embedded <ng-container * ngIf = "column! == 'select'"> stops working. Throws an error: "Duplicate column definition name provided:" select "". In version 8 it works.

Steps to reproduce:
When updating @ angular / material to version 9, the template stops working. In version 8 it works.

Example for version 9: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ky8jxx-select-table-yd9qsd?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

Example for version 8: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ky8jxx-select-table-dvzqbi?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

If you remove the wrapper with <ng-container * ngIf = "column! == 'select'">, then it starts working in version 9, but this is not the kind of behavior that is required, since there are different templates for different columns.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The template works in version 9.


#### Actual Behavior

Template stopped working in version 9


#### Environment

- Angular: ^9.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^9.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 81
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([mat-table]): [Nested ng-container inside mat-table stopped working]" (#19324)

Issues.Title: refactor(icon): change deprecated APIs for version 10
Issues.Body:
Changes the APIs that were marked as deprecated for v10.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* The `_location` and `_errorHandler` parameters in the `MatIcon` constructor are now required.
* The `_errorHandler` parameter in the `MatIconRegistry` constructor is now required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(icon): change deprecated APIs for version 10" (#19323)

Issues.Title: fix: unable to set expanded or collapsed height in expansion panel
Issues.Body:
For the density system, we reworked the expansion panel to no longer
rely on Angular animations. Looks like the refactoring missed that units
are already set for the `expandedHeight` and `collapsedHeight` inputs.

This hasn't been catched in any unit test, so tests are updated to catch this now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: unable to set expanded or collapsed height in expansion panel" (#19322)

Issues.Title: fix(table): incorrectly sticking multiple footer rows
Issues.Body:
The loop that sticks headers and footers is run in reverse for footers. The problem is that we were only reversing the order of the elements, but not the sticky states which resulted in them being flipped. E.g. setting the last row to be sticky would actually stick the first one.

Fixes #19311.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): incorrectly sticking multiple footer rows" (#19321)

Issues.Title: feat(benchmarks): setup for benchmarking components
Issues.Body:
### Summary

* Set up components repo to use dev-infra benchmarking tools
* Create first set of benchmark tests for mat-checkbox

### Current Workaround

This change depends on two changes to angular/angular.

1. PR [#36800](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36800)
2. The resolution of Issue [#36986](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36986)

Until those changes have been made, the current workaround is to

1. Checkout the working branch for PR [#36800](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36800)
2. Fix Issue [#36986](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36986)
3. Run `yarn bazel build //dev-infra:npm_package.pack` to create a local version of dev-infra

This workaround allows us to change the package.json in angular/components to depend on the files from this locally published version of dev-infra.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(benchmarks): setup for benchmarking components" (#19320)

Duplicated the mixin changes to the MDC equivalent.

After this PR, we should be comfortable publishing official documentation to Angular Material on using strong focus indicators.

Issues.Title: bug([MatFormFieldHarness]): getControl() returns first input on the page, not the input within the form field
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a form with two mat form fields, each with a respective mat input
2. Get the harness for the 2nd form field's mat input (via the 2nd form field harness' `getControl()` method), and set it to any value.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Setting the value of the mat input returned by `getControl()` should set the value of the mat input associated with the corresponding form field.

#### Actual Behavior

Setting the value of the mat input returned by `getControl()` sets the value of the first mat input on the page, not necessarily the one associated with the form field. 

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.1
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): Jest 25.5.4
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([MatFormFieldHarness]): getControl() returns first input on the page, not the input within the form field" (#19315)

Issues.Title: [BUG][CDK TABLE]: Footer Rows Are Sticked In Wrong Order
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

BUG: Sticked footer rows in a material table are sticked in the reversed order.

#### What is the expected behavior?

< table footer row 1 sticky >
< table footer row 2 >
< table footer row 3 >

#### What is the current behavior?

< table footer row 1 >
< table footer row 2 >
< table footer row 3 sticky > <-- this one was sticked

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Create a mat table and add three footer rows, make the first one sticked.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
 "@angular/cdk": "^9.2.3",
 "@angular/common": "~9.1.6",
 "@angular/core": "~9.1.6",
 "@angular/material": "^9.2.3",
 "typescript": "~3.8.3"
  Max OSX 10.15.5 beta
```
#### Is there anything else we should know?

This is what I did to fix it:

[file]  [https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/table/sticky-styler.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/table/sticky-styler.ts)
[function]  stickRows(rowsToStick: HTMLElement[], stickyStates: boolean[], position: 'top' | 'bottom') {...}

After line 123
```
[line 123] const rows = position === 'bottom' ? rowsToStick.reverse() : rowsToStick;
```
Add
```
 stickyStates = position === "bottom" ? stickyStates.reverse() : stickyStates;
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[BUG][CDK TABLE]: Footer Rows Are Sticked In Wrong Order" (#19311)

Issues.Title: build: prevent bazel from logging warning on each invocation
Issues.Body:
Each time ibazel is run, it logs something like:

```
INFO: Build completed successfully, 14 total actions

################################################################################
# Did you know iBazel can invoke programs like Gazelle, buildozer, and         #
# other BUILD file generators for you automatically based on bazel output?     #
# Documentation at: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-watcher#output-runner  #
################################################################################

iBazel [3:24PM]: Use default regex
```

These changes avoid the annoying banner by adding a `.bazel_fix_commands.json` file according to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-watcher#output-runner. Note that we it seems like we should be able to do the same by passing the `--run_output=false` flag, but I wasn't able to get it to work through the `.bazelrc`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: prevent bazel from logging warning on each invocation" (#19298)
